title: Landlord Demanding Unlawful Rent Increase
description: When your landlord demands an unreasonable rent increase or increases rent without following proper legal procedures, you have rights to challenge this action.

rights.title: Protection Under Rent Control Laws
rights.description: Tenants are protected against arbitrary rent increases under state rent control acts.
rights.application: Applies to properties covered under rent control acts. Rent can only be increased as per prescribed rates and procedures.
limitations: Not all properties are covered under rent control

rights.title: Right to Proper Notice for Rent Increase
rights.description: Landlord must give adequate notice before increasing rent as per tenancy agreement or local laws.
rights.application: Usually 1-3 months notice required depending on rent payment frequency and local laws.
examples: Must be in writing for rent-controlled properties

actionSteps.title: Review Your Tenancy Agreement
actionSteps.description: Check your rent agreement for clauses about rent increases, notice periods, and any escalation terms.

actionSteps.title: Check Local Rent Control Laws
actionSteps.description: Verify if your property falls under rent control and what are the permissible rent increase rates.

actionSteps.title: Send Written Response to Landlord
actionSteps.description: Respond in writing to the rent increase notice, stating your objections with legal basis.
templates: Objection letter template for unlawful rent increase

actionSteps.title: Approach Rent Controller/Tribunal
actionSteps.description: File application with rent controller or housing tribunal if landlord persists with unlawful increase.
